thread.section_title: Archive News & Video for Tuesday, 06 Mar 2018 | Reuters.com
thread.title: South, North Korea to hold summit in April: South Korea says

author: Reuters Editorial
title: South, North Korea to hold summit in April: South Korea says
text:
SEOUL (Reuters) - North and South Korea will hold their first summit in more than a decade in late April, the Southâ€™s presidential office said on Tuesday after a senior delegation returned from a visit to the North where they met leader Kim Jong Un.
North Korean leader Kim Jong Un shakes hands with Chung Eui-yong who is leading a special delegation of South Korea's President. KCNA/via Reuters North Korea said there was no need to keep its nuclear program as long as there was no military threat against it and the safety of its regime was secured, the head of the delegation, Chung Eui-yong, told a media briefing.
North Korea also said it was open to talking with the United States regarding denuclearization and normalizing ties, Chung added.
Reporting by Christine Kim; Editing by Nick Macfie
